author: frozenfire.eth
content: Is there any method other than using CREATE2 and then DELEGATECALL to execute arbitrary opcode from calldata within a given contract?

author: _shemnon
content: Ordinary CREATE works, but that is not a pattern that I think fits into most smart contract mold (immutable predictable execution).  For EOF that pattern will require CREATE4.  Be kind and SELFDESTRUCT at the end of the contract.

author: frozenfire.eth
content: My goal is to have a contract which verifies a GROTH16 proof of a commitment to arbitrary bytecode, checks that the subsequent calldata matches the commitment, and then delegates into it.

author: frozenfire.eth
content: I thought that SELFDESTRUCT was deprecated?

author: abcoathup
content:
SELFDESTRUCT is deprecated since Shapella: 
https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-6049
https://blog.ethereum.org/2023/03/28/shapella-mainnet-announcement

author: _shemnon
content: Yes, EIP-6780 is what I was alluding to with cleanup.
